data.title: Orders Typically Incomplete/Wrong
data.text: They typically mess up the order at this location. Typical Sonic though. Their burgers have gotten better than they were, onion rings always delish. Lots of drink options as we all know.  Nice to be able to sit in your car and dine.

data.title: Awful
data.text: I've went here twice over a couple of weeks. They apparently can't hear you when ordering so you have to repeat yourself and yell. Then it comes up on the screen right but the ticket and order are wrong. The first time I didn't get the right meal or even the dessert--the drink was right, though--and it took nearly half an hour to come out cold. Today I got at least the right meal but the tots came out cold and kid's size, my drink a medium not tea, and my shake came out with warm whipped cream. I don't like McDonald's but at least I get what I pay for.

data.title: Walking to a Drive-In amused our waitress ;)
data.text: On vacation from California and in need of a little exercise we walked to this Sonic Drive-in.  We got chili cheese tots and a green chile cheeseburger - neither of which exist where we live. What a fabulous guilty pleasure :) The food was hot and fresh - the tots were crunchy and properly cooked - and the waitress had a nice chat with us when she brought our food out to the table.

data.title: Nothing special.
data.text: Recently closed due to Public Health Inspection, this is just a convenience stop. When they run specials on their shakes I will buy one but not at their regular prices. Food is bland and routine fast food.

data.title: Cute But Not Too Tasty
data.text: The retro 50's style carhops on roller skates were delightfully perky, friendly and efficient.  But even their enthusiasm couldn't make up for the poor quality hot dogs my wife and I were served.  I had a hot fudge sundae that was essentially some soft vanilla ice cream with too much whipped cream and only a small drizzle of cold chocolate syrup.  We will not be returning.
